bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to Thomas F. Bayard, April 4, 1887
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Digest Invoice Book-- Arrivals and departures of American vessels-- record of official fees-- summary of Consular Business-- abstracts of contingent Expenses Account for salary-- Account for cable-gram.
Hon T. F. Bayard Secy of State Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith the returns for the quarter ending March 31, 1887 of this Consulate General. Please find the same to be as follows: Digest of the Invoice Book (1) Arrivals and departures of American vessels (2) Record
Record of official fees (3) Summary of Consular business (4) Abstract of Contingent expenses (5) Account for salary (6) Account for cable-gram (7).
The returns for Gold Coast are not enclosed because up to this time they have not been recieved.
I have the honor to be ,sir, your obedient Servant
Samuel S Sevier U.S. Vice Consul Gen
1. Digest of Invoice Book 2. Arrival & departures 3. Record of official fees &c
